title: More romanian folklore - 3 compilations w. notes
description:
3 compilations meant to present romanian folklore to an international audience. The first one, Greetings From Romania Vol. 1 - produced in holland, introduces a wide range of regional styles, with the occasional lautareasca theme - check out Hora de la Clejani -, all orchestrated in the typical electrecord tradition, unfortunately, no info on the performing artists is available. The second one, Music around the world: Romania, introduces a rare instrument in romanian folkloric recording-history: the piano (!). The disc is loveable for that reason alone, but there is also a lot of nice gypsy violin on this record. I think these recordings are pretty old but i've no way to be sure. Three artists are listed but no explanation as to who plays what is granted :(
Last one, World Library of Folk and Primitive Music - Romania, is a nicely documented (check the inside-folder), with a lot of recordings ranging from rural amateurs to urban pro's (or the other way around?). 
Enjoy :)

Greetings From Romania Vol. 1

Produs: INTERCONT (Holland)
Format: mp3
Samplerate: 44100 Hz
Channels: stereo
Bitrate: 128 kbps
Marime: 192 MB

1. Hora Staccatto

4. Ceasornicul

18. Calusul oltenesc

Disc ce prezinta selectiv si sintetic repere originale 
ale folclorului romanesc. Dirijor: Paraschiv Oprea; 
Design: Daniel Muller; Foto: Paul Agarici;   


Music around the world Romania

Produs: GALAXY

World Library of Folk and Primitive Music - Romania

Format / Calitate: MP3 128 kbps
Marime: 65 MB

Tezaur folcloric romanesc din toate regiunile tarii. 
Albumul contine informatii privind zona, anul inregistrarii si interpreti. 
Inregistrari din anii 1937-1957 
Compilatie editata de Alan Lomax
